1.heading: Advice.
1.title: "Almost Pure Evil"
1.author: Scott Adams.
notes: Summary: Dogbert gives advice on how to deal with the new bad technology.
Key words: Integrating, goofing off, bosses, upgrades, buying.

2.heading: Advice.
2.title: "Also, Don't Look Up"
2.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Sarge is hanging on edge of a cliff, with a bear standing above him and Beetle gives advice.

3.heading: Advice.
3.title: "Ask Him If They're Offering Any Freebaits"
3.author: by Tom Batiuk and Chris Ayers.
notes: Summary: Crankshaft is giving advice on the car lot.

4.heading: Advice.
4.title: "At Least Y'all Won't Have to Worry about the Ever-Rising Cost of Living"
4.author: by Leigh Rubin.
notes: Summary: A man being lynched is given some advice.

5.heading: Advice.
5.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
5.author: [No author]

6.heading: Advice.
6.title: "Blossoms and Beaux!"
6.author: [No author]
6.series: Datewise) 2 p. non-fiction in Wonder Woman, no. 107
notes: Advice for boys about flowers for dates, reprinted from an issue of A Date With Judy, cf. Gene Reed and Lou Mougin, via Grand Comic-Book Database.

7.heading: Advice.
7.title: "But Don't Tell Your Husband"
7.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Series: Listen to your Mother : Helga Tells It Like It Is.
Summary: It doesn't take much to make a wife happy.
Key words: Secrets, advice.

8.heading: Advice.
8.title: "Crunch Lunch"
8.author: Ferd and Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Kayo has some advice for his best friend Scratch: Stick to your doggie kibble and forget the stuff they serve me.

9.heading: Advice.
9.title: "De Interés General" 1 p. advice in Confesiones de Amor, no. 5
9.author: [No author]
9.series: Oct. 1956) ; also appears in Confesiones de Amor, no. 11
notes: Illustrated advice about eyebrow pencils, tobacco pipes, and measuring tapes.

10.heading: Advice.
10.title: "Dial-a-Mom"
10.author: Breathed.
notes: Summary: Over the telephone, Opus gets advice about wearing rubbers on rainy days and marrying a plain girl.

11.heading: Advice.
11.title: "Dieta"
11.author: [No author]
11.series: Condorito) p. 58 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: 2 tiers. An overweight sword-swallower comes to dietician Condorito for advice, and Condorito says to only swallow razor blades for 6 months.

12.heading: Advice.
12.title: "Do It Yourself"
12.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: Louie tries to give advice in the kitchen, and ends up cooking (and burning) the meal himself.
Silent strip.

13.heading: Advice.
13.title: "The Doctor Attends a Tennis Match and Offers Some Advice"
13.author: Lloyd Ostendorf
13.appears_in: p. 23-29 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Facts, v. 3, no. 20 (May 25, 1948).

14.heading: Advice.
14.title: "A Fifth Column Plot and Atomic Disgrace!"
14.author: Alfred James, Mel Casson.
notes: Summary: Dilly gives rhyming advice about women's hats.

15.heading: Advice.
15.title: "First I'd Give My Caddie $10, Then I'd Close My Eyes"
15.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: General Halftrack is in a sand trap, and asks Beetle for advice.

16.heading: Advice.
16.title: "First, Stop Trying to Be All Things to All People"
16.author: M
notes: Summary: A cat is giving advice to a dog.

17.heading: Advice.
17.title: "Futuropolis" p. 49 in Agrippina
17.author: Claire Bretécher (London : Methuen, 1991).
notes: Summary: Agrippina listens to career advice, and decides to be a homeopathic surgeon.

18.heading: Advice.
18.title: "George Washington's Advice" p. 50-52 in True Comics, no. 9
18.author: [No author]

19.heading: Advice.
19.title: "The Girl Who is Right to Spend My Life With"
19.author: by Dean Young and Denis Lebrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood has easy advice on how to know when he's found her.

20.heading: Advice.
20.title: "Give Her a Choice. Let Her Decide"
20.author: Greg.
notes: Summary: Luann thinks Brad should take T.J.'s advice and ask Toni Daytona out, so she's not stuck with Dirk.

21.heading: Advice.
21.title: "Habla, Maldita Cotorra!"
21.author: [No author]
notes: Sisimo has a parrot that won't talk, and a talking dog gives him advice.

22.heading: Advice.
22.title: "I Hate Money Because It's Come Between My Love and Me!"
22.author: Al Capp & Bob Lubbers.
notes: Summary: Lisbeth is unhappy, and Sam's advice is to get rid of the money.

23.heading: Advice.
23.title: "I Quit This Stupid Game!"
23.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Thirsty is ready to walk off the course, but he stops to give Hi advice on his swing.

24.heading: Advice.
24.title: "I Suck at Checkers"
24.author: by Mark Ilich.
notes: Summary: Johnee has unexpected advice about a relationship.

25.heading: Advice.
25.title: "I'd Straighten that Left Arm a Bit, and Turn that Right Hand Over More"
25.author: Jim Davis
25.appears_in: reproduced on p. 137 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Jon has knocked out an old lady with his golf shot, and asks Garfield for advice.

26.heading: Advice.
26.title: "If I Were You I Wouldn't Buy Any Lottery Tickets Today"
26.author: Young & Lebrun.
notes: Summary: On a day when a dog woke him up early, he broke a shoelace, etc., Dagwood asks for a raise and Mr. Dithers gives him advice instead.

27.heading: Advice.
27.title: "Jimmy Otter Gets Some Down Home Advice"
27.author: by Ted Richards.
27.series: E.Z. Wolf) 1 p. in E.Z. Wolf, no. 1

28.heading: Advice.
28.title: "Latch Key Annie"
28.author: by Tim Downs.
notes: Summary: Little Orphan Annie gets advice on how to update herself.

29.heading: Advice.

29.author: Hoest

notes: Summary: Loretta is giving a friend some advice about dealing with husbands.

30.heading: Advice.

30.author: Lynn.
30.series: For Better or For Worse, Nov. 28, 1992

31.heading: Advice.

32.heading: Advice.
32.title: "A Managed Stock Fund with High Churn and a Big Front-End Load"
32.author: by Scott Adams.
notes: Summary: Wally gets financial advice.

33.heading: Advice.

33.author: [No author]
33.series: Condorito) p. 62 in Condorito de Oro, no. 75
notes: 3 tiers. When women approach Doctor Condorito at parties for free medical advice, he has a way to get rid of them. He tells them to undress.

34.heading: Advice.
34.title: "Mind Your Make-Up!"
34.author: [No author]
34.series: Tips to Teens) 2 p. non-fiction in Wonder Woman, no. 90
notes: Illustrated and rhyming advice about cosmetics.

35.heading: Advice.
35.title: "Mom, I Want Your Advice on Something Important"
35.author: Scott and Borgman.
notes: Summary: Jeremy asks for advice, but reserves the right to disrespect it, and when she decides not to give him the advice under his conditions he wonders if she'll take the blame if he decides badly.

36.heading: Advice.
36.title: "More Than One Way to Skin a Cat"
36.author: by Dave Coverly.
notes: Summary: A dog gives advice to a puppy. On the doghouse is the name "Quino."

37.heading: Advice.
37.title: "Mowing the Lawn Might Make You Feel Better"
37.author: Hoest.
notes: Summary: Loretta offers advice to a bedraggled Leroy in his pajamas.

38.heading: Advice.
38.title: "The Next Time She Kicks You Out Be Sure She's Not Wearing Golf Shoes"
38.author: Ramzah.
notes: Summary: The doctor has advice.

39.heading: Advice.
39.title: "Now is Reine the Chick Who Likes Star Wars because Princess Leia Offers a Sensible Role Model for Women in the Corporate World?"
39.author: Michael Jantze.
notes: Summary: Chris/Chewbacca's advice is to marry her right away.

40.heading: Advice.
40.title: "Ye Olde Saw"
40.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Freckles' dad responds to Miss Darcy's advice by quoting an old saying, 'A man pursues a woman until she catches him'.

41.heading: Advice.
41.title: "Our Commencement Speaker, Ms. Cynthia Summers"
41.author: Tom Batiuk & Chuck Ayers.
notes: Summary: She starts off with the idea of getting advice on life from a TV news anchor, which she seems to expect them to find incongruous.

42.heading: Advice.
42.title: "Sino Tiene Nada de Eso, Para Que Demonios la Vas a Conquistar!"
42.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Advice on how to compliment a woman.
From Diario las Americas (Miami), Feb. 3, 2000.

43.heading: Advice.

129.title: The Advocate
129.author: by K
129.series: Oct. 25, 1988) "Gay Toons : Calling All Animated Characters : Will You Come Out and Play?"
129.appears_in: Bruce. p. 32-37 in The Advocate, no. 510 (Oct. 25, 1988).
notes: Suggestive profiles of Snagglepuss, Elmer Fudd, Roger Rabbit, The Seven Dwarfs, Geppetto, Mad Hatter & March Hare, Chip and Dale, Schroeder (Peanuts), The Pink Panther, Droopy, and Bugs Bunny.

Interview, mainly about the second X-Men movie.

142.title: The Advocate
142.author: by Lawrence Ferber

coded, metrosexual, lesbian
and LGBT writers and artists will make this July's Comic-Con International in San Diego one of the gayest ever."

143.title: The Advocate
143.author: Will Doig
notes: "This July, the lovable yellow clan hits the big screen in the Simpsons movie. Will Doig looks at how the cartoon has led the way for our acceptance in American culture, and taught us tolerance in the process.
Cover title: "How the Simpsons Took the Fear out of Queer."
Contents page title: "Simpsons Nation."
